title: A Look at the Hosts of CNN+; Journalists Chris Wallace and Kasie Hunt are among those who left other outlets to join the short-lived streaming service
text:
It is unclear if the talent hired exclusively for the new platform would continue to host their respective shows. At a town hall meeting on Thursday, CNN Chairman and Chief Executive Chris Licht said content from CNN+ will move to other platforms at parent Warner Bros. Discovery, including CNN.

Hosts typically have a contract with the network, while many behind-the-scenes staffers don't. Mr. Licht said CNN+ employees would be paid and receive benefits for the next three months and can explore potential jobs elsewhere at the company.

Here is a list of some of the talent CNN+ wooed to the streaming platform:

Chris Wallace

Perhaps one of CNN's biggest names added to the streaming service was longtime Fox News anchor Chris Wallace.

"I am excited to explore the world of streaming," Mr. Wallace said in December when his new role was announced. The veteran journalist, whose hard-hitting interviews have been a fixture of Washington politics for years, said he was looking forward to the "new freedom and flexibility streaming affords in interviewing major figures across the news landscape and finding new ways to tell stories."

On his show, "Who's Talking to Chris Wallace," he has interviewed White House press secretary Jen Psaki, former Disney Chief Executive Robert Iger and director James Cameron, among others.

Kasie Hunt

Kasie Hunt, a former NBC News and MSNBC journalist, moved to CNN+ to host "The Source with Kasie Hunt," a weekday show focused on politics.

"The journalists I have been privileged to work with on CNN Plus are world class," Ms. Hunt said on Twitter after the news Thursday.

After some people asked about her, she added in a subsequent tweet: "I am proud to be on team CNN. I will be fine. It's not about me right now."

A udie Cornish

Longtime National Public Radio host of "All Things Considered" Audie Cornish was tapped by CNN to be an anchor and correspondent for CNN+. Her planned roles at the outlet include host of a weekly show, "20 Questions with Audie Cornish," podcast host for CNN Audio and contributor to CNN+'s live programming.

Eva Longoria

Actress Eva Longoria's series "Eva Longoria: Searching for Mexico," was set to debut on CNN+. The show was described by CNN as an "exciting iteration of the critically acclaimed CNN Original Series Stanley Tucci: Searching for Italy." Both Ms. Longoria and Mr. Tucci are executive producers.

Cari Champion and Jemele Hill

Longtime ESPN broadcast journalists Cari Champion and Jemele Hill were brought on to the streaming service to host a show together. The two came to CNN from a weekly talk show they hosted on Vice TV. Ms. Champion and Ms. Hill also spent many years at ESPN in various high-profile roles, including on "SportsCenter."

After the announcement Thursday, Ms. Hill took to Twitter to respond to critics. "Some of y'all are going to try to get jokes off at my expense but I'm going to be fine—it's called a contract, learn about it," she wrote. "But there are people who are part of our show staff who do not have the same protection."

Alison Roman

Cook and author Alison Roman, who made her name at Bon Appétit before branching out on her own, was brought on to host a new cooking show. "I've been dreaming about bringing a new sort of cooking and food show to life for years and I can't think of any place better to make it a reality," Ms. Roman said at the time, according to a CNN statement

Scott Galloway

Scott Galloway, a New York University marketing professor, podcaster and internet personality, was hired to host a new show focused on the "news and conversations where business and technology collide," according to a CNN statement in September 2021.

"No Mercy No Malice with Scott Galloway" has included episodes on the Web 3.0 and the risks of the metaverse.

"Well that was fast," Mr. Galloway said in a video posted to Twitter on Thursday. He added that he "loved every second of this" and was "incredibly grateful."
